intro: Erysimum glaucum, commonly known as the glaucous wallflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in a waxy, bluish-gray coating. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are borne on elongated pedicels. Its flowers are composed of four petals and are often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Erysimum glaucum is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
